definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
(coll.) to look every bit the big star

sentences.english: The dates are, in fact, astronomical, astrological and astrotheological.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个日期是天文学，占星术和星相学。

sentences.english: The quest for enchantment is a reason for astrology's popularity.
sentences.chinese: 长期对于魅惑的探索是星相学普及的原因。

sentences.english: Last month was, by anyone's estimation who knows astrology, the most difficult of the year.
sentences.chinese: 过去的九月份是所有懂得星相学公认的艰难时刻。

sentences.english: Why can not astrology co-exist with the myth of science?
sentences.chinese: 为什么星相学不能与科学的神话共存？

sentences.english: ‘I knew we would be laughed at for putting credence in astrology, ’ says Catherine.
sentences.chinese: “我知道我们相信星相学会被人嘲笑，”凯瑟琳说。

sentences.english: Taurus belongs to a group of signs which astrologers call earth signs.
sentences.chinese: 金牛座属于被星相学家命名的一组土象星座。

sentences.english: Cancer belongs to a group of signs which astrologers call water signs.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座属于星相学家们定义的水象星座。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
Zi Wei Dou Shu, a form of Chinese fortune-telling
constellation (arch., now 星座)/one of the 28 constellations of traditional Chinese astronomy and astrology/motion of stars since one's birth (predetermining one's fate in astrology)
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling
